trans-unit.source: Determine Azure Backup storage redundancy options | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Determine Azure Backup storage redundancy options | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Understand the difference between geo redundant storage and locally redundant storage to determine your Azure Backup storage redundancy option.
trans-unit.target: Understand the difference between geo redundant storage and locally redundant storage to determine your Azure Backup storage redundancy option.

trans-unit.source: Storage redundancy options for Azure Backup
trans-unit.target: Storage redundancy options for Azure Backup

trans-unit.source: Your business needs will determine the appropriate storage redundancy option for Azure Backup storage.
trans-unit.target: Your business needs will determine the appropriate storage redundancy option for Azure Backup storage.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure as a primary backup storage endpoint (e.g. you are backing up to Azure from a Windows Server), you should consider picking (the default) geo-redundant storage option.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure as a primary backup storage endpoint (e.g. you are backing up to Azure from a Windows Server), you should consider picking (the default) geo-redundant storage option.

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure as a tertiary backup storage endpoint (e.g. you are using SCDPM to have a local backup copy on-premises and using Azure for your long term retention needs), you should consider choosing locally redundant storage
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure as a tertiary backup storage endpoint (e.g. you are using SCDPM to have a local backup copy on-premises and using Azure for your long term retention needs), you should consider choosing locally redundant storage

trans-unit.source: Geo-redundant storage (GRS)
trans-unit.target: Geo-redundant storage (GRS)

trans-unit.source: Geo-redundant storage maintains six copies of your data.
trans-unit.target: Geo-redundant storage maintains six copies of your data.

trans-unit.source: With GRS, your data is replicated three times within the primary region, and is also replicated three times in a secondary region hundreds of miles away from the primary region, providing the highest level of durability.
trans-unit.target: With GRS, your data is replicated three times within the primary region, and is also replicated three times in a secondary region hundreds of miles away from the primary region, providing the highest level of durability.

trans-unit.source: In the event of a failure at the primary region, by storing data in GRS, Azure Backup ensures that your data is durable in two separate regions.
trans-unit.target: In the event of a failure at the primary region, by storing data in GRS, Azure Backup ensures that your data is durable in two separate regions.

trans-unit.source: Locally Redundant Storage (LRS)
trans-unit.target: Locally Redundant Storage (LRS)

trans-unit.source: Locally redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.
trans-unit.target: Locally redundant storage maintains three copies of your data.

trans-unit.source: LRS is replicated three times within a single facility in a single region.
trans-unit.target: LRS is replicated three times within a single facility in a single region.

trans-unit.source: LRS protects your data from normal hardware failures, but not from the failure of an entire Azure facility.
trans-unit.target: LRS protects your data from normal hardware failures, but not from the failure of an entire Azure facility.

trans-unit.source: This brings down the cost of storing data in Azure, while providing a lower level of durability for your data that might be acceptable for tertiary copies.
trans-unit.target: This brings down the cost of storing data in Azure, while providing a lower level of durability for your data that might be acceptable for tertiary copies.

trans-unit.source: You can select the appropriate option for your needs from the **Configure** option of your backup vault.
trans-unit.target: You can select the appropriate option for your needs from the **Configure** option of your backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Make sure your environment is [prepared to back up a Windows server or client machine](backup-configure-vault.md)
trans-unit.target: Make sure your environment is [prepared to back up a Windows server or client machine](backup-configure-vault.md)

trans-unit.source: If you still have unanswered questions, take a look at the [Azure Backup FAQ](backup-azure-backup-faq.md).
trans-unit.target: If you still have unanswered questions, take a look at the [Azure Backup FAQ](backup-azure-backup-faq.md).

trans-unit.source: Visit the [Azure Backup forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=290933)
trans-unit.target: Visit the [Azure Backup forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=290933)
